author: bookfn44
authorRole: the patient
title: Newton Stewart hospital, vaccinations
body:
Terrible experience with one of the nurses. I was having routine vaccinations and the nurse was extremely blunt and it seemed they were not trained in dealing with Autistic patients. They hurried me through the vaccines not giving me any information other than take paracetamol if it hurts, Autism trained nurses always explain exactly what is happening and help as much as possible, they also are supposed to offer a private room seeing a sunflower lanyard (which I was clearly wearing.)  
They were rough with the needles which were painful and bled lots, so much as so they bled through my t-shirt. They didn't apologize or anything.  
I'm a wheelchair user so badly done needles mean I can't push myself for a few days. This takes away my freedom and the ability to leave my bed. Thanks to this I'm going to be scared for my next vaccine appointment and will leave me unable to move for about a week.

readBy.name: NHS Dumfries and Galloway
St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

title: Big Thank You
body: All I can say is this is the best surgery in Witham , my Doctor was very helpful and she listened to everything I needed to talk to her about, which I found brilliant, also booked me my blood test there and then. Thank You to the Doctors, Nurses, receptionists, and all the staff,I have and still will recommend the Health Centre, Well Done.

title: Very helpful
body: The review with specialist audiology was extremely helpful with future life decisions.  I was allotted a good amount of time and many tests were done.  I have recommended this service to a neighbour who also suffers from dizziness.

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The level of care I have been receiving from the staff in this hospital is excellent
body: The level of care I have been receiving from the staff in this hospital is excellent, there all great people and are looking after me very well. I feel very comfortable on this ward there’s lots of room and it’s cleaned really well throughout the day. The facilities are all good and are close to my room which is handy as I don’t have to go very far.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great service
body: Very happy with the service and the way I was dealt with from ringing for an appointment to seeing the doctor. She was not my usual doctor but the way she spoke to me and dealt with me was great, made me feel like a real person unlike just another patient. Wasn't robotic and made good rapport. Her diagnosis was spot on and the treatment she prescribed has worked and I'm nearly back to normal.  Keep up the good work and many thanks again.

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: all the staff were doing their very best
body: I was admitted via an ambulance it arrived within an hour and when I got into the emergency department the staff were all okay, they were very busy as there was lots of patients. I had just about enough room although it did feel a bit crowded, other than that I came across no issues, all the staff were doing their very best. The ward has been more quiet and I able to relax a bit more as I feel comfortable up here. The staff are all very caring and I get along with the nurses very well.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: excellent level of care
body: I have been on this was for two weeks, the staff have all been taking great care of me, I don’t feel they need to improve in any way, the level of care has been excellent. The ward facilities are very clean and I find the beds very comfortable. The noise of the ward sometimes is an issue as it can get a bit annoying after a while. The food hasn’t been that bad but it does get very sickening after a while and there isn’t much to choose from, it’s pretty basic.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great experience
body: I visited the allergy department at Kings. The clinic was held in the venetian building and the set up was really good. The staff were all lovely but particularly the receptionist who was working. She was helpful and made people laugh and she made us feel very welcome.

title: Professional, caring practice team
body: Everyone, from the front desk team to GPs to nurses to dispensary team are caring, professional and compassionate. I have been with this practice for several years and the team is consistent in providing a high quality service to patients. I cannot praise the practice team highly enough.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Doctors are so polite
body: My care has been brilliant and I feel as if I have been treated very well since my arrival into the hospital, something that I am more than happy about. The doctors were round this morning and were very polite and took a lot of time to explain everything being very clear. The nurses have been very kind to me and have been brilliant in the day to day side of my care. They are so sweet and always are checking up on the patients to make sure we are happy and have no issues in the hospital. The foods okay, I have never been a big eater so the portions that I get are more than enough and always leave me full. I have had no issues with my care as it has been so good and is something I am very happy with.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great practice
body: The receptionist was a very helpful, friendly lady who helped me with numerous queries today, murdishaw health centre is a great practice, very efficient, great team…

title: Great patient care
body:
Visited A&E, although the staff were under pressure they were superb, great patient care.
The Doctor on duty, who I'm not allowed to name was brilliant, we were all so pleased with his bedside manner and extreme patience under immense pressure in this current climate. Thank you 💗 to all staff members

readBy.name: North Cheshire Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a service user
title: Needs to be more communication
body: My care has been good so far however I feel there needs to be more communication between the staff and patients. The levels are alright I just feel I like to be more kept in the loop. The staff are more than happy to answer questions but general progress reports could go a long way. The nurses are fantastic I am more than happy with them. They are always so busy they never stop which must be very difficult but they still come in smile and loom after us patients well. The doctors are my heroes have done so much to make me feel better and helped me understand everything. The food is really good. I have had a brilliant level of care and am more than happy with everything I have experienced in the hospital

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Excellent staff
body: My care has been very good so far and I would honestly say I have been treated excellently so far. The nurses have been very good as well and take so much time to make sure we are all happy. They have been so kind and the little things such as cup teas make them absolute heroes. The doctors have all been very approachable and have been amazing in how informative they are as they have kept me so up to date with everything. The food has been amazing the variety is more than exceptional and it is so nice to get good food. I have had no issues with my care and am more than happy due to the excellent of the staff

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Very efficient
body: Thanks NHS for a good service today.  Was sent to A&E by my GP.  Had an MRI and follow up.  Very efficient  from reception, triage, imaging team and drs.  Thank you

readBy.name: Royal Cornwall Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Worth getting ill for!
body:
I’m just leaving Hopkins Ward after having a hysterectomy. I can’t thank this wonderful team enough for their warm, friendly, kind care. I was looked after so well. I’m sad to leave! 

And a huge shout-out to the gynaecology team for my operation. Again, I was treated with endless respect and compassion. 

This hospital is a credit to the NHS. Thank you all so much.

readBy.name: Royal Berkshire NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic admin and reception
body: I am the daughter in law of one of your poorly patients. mb constantly goes above and beyond to provide best holistic appropriate care and support. Not only does she ensure dad gets amazing care she always considers his and our ideas, needs and expectations. As a family, mb and all admin staff we cant thank you enough for your seamless care (people are too quick to have a go at admin and reception but you all do an amazing job) thank you from the whole family xx

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: All nurses are class
body: My care has been alright so far and I am very happy with the care I have received. The nurses that I are on the ward are all good, form the night shift to weekend crew they have all been so good and throughput their whole shift the levels of care remain consistently amazing. The doctors have also all been good and I have found them to be very helpful due to their natured of being clear and concise which has helped me understand everything. The food has actually been amazing I enjoy every meal that I get and am more than happy with portions. I have had no issues with my care and am more than happy with it.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Good staff at children's department
body: I had a good experience with my child at the children’s a&e. The nurse in the triage was very qualified, and asked all the right questions. We were put in a special room for children with autism and he even got a sticker. When we finally saw the doctor who was newly training to be a GP, she was thorough and kind, taking the time to listen and explain what she was doing to my child so he was not too upset when he was examined. At the end we got information sent via text. The whole process was very organised. I know it can get very busy so I appreciate all the staff who work hard to provide good care to patients. Thank you again.

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Unexlained reason for still being here
body: My care in here has been good however it has been a very long experience. The reason this has been so difficult is that the staff haven’t been communicating with me on why I am in here so long they haven’t really gave me a good reason to justify this so I am a bit confused about everything. This is a struggle as I don’t know potential discharge or why it is not possible. The nurses have been fine and have done so much to help me with my care and make sure I am happy. The doctors I rarely see they are nice enough but I cannot communicate with them and ask questions if I do not see them... The food has been fine the portions are alright however the menu gas got boring. I have had no issues with my acre and am, very happy for it. The care has been good I just want why I have jo been given a discharge explained

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

title: Extremely happy
body: I doubt I can adequately describe my feelings about my stay at the hospital nearly three weeks ago now for hip replacement surgery, from which I am making good progress in my recovery. I was understandably nervous at the thought of the operation, but felt more relaxed as time passed, as the staff somehow imparted to me confidence in their competence that they would see me through it all. I felt fully informed along the way and cared for with kindness and efficiency at all times from my first appointment. I particularly loved the words of the wonderful consultant anaesthetist, who told me I was part of their team for the time it took for my operation. It was a great way to make me feel special. I enjoyed listening to the banter and camaraderie of the theatre team, whilst they carried out my operation so highly efficiently and was impressed by the way they showed their respect for each other. I also loved the sense of humour of my consultant when he spoke to me before the operation. He made me feel totally confident in his care and I also appreciated that he popped in to see me before I left the hospital the next day. The nursing team were wonderful, physios and Xray staff kind and efficient and everything was very clean. I was very impressed with the amazing food, delivered always with a smile by members of the catering team. The meals would put some restaurants to shame. I have also been impressed by the follow-up phone calls from ward staff and physios since I have been home, always assuring me they are there if I need them. I am grateful as well to the pharmacist, who was so quick to send tablets that had been left out of the pack I brought home with me, and to the Booking team, who are so friendly and efficient. I hope I haven't left anyone out and if I have that they will consider themselves included in my thanks. I also hope my sincere gratitude can be passed on to everyone. I can now bore at length to anyone who will listen about the amazing experience I had due to all concerned and won't hesitate to recommend the Hospital to anyone who is considering where to have their operation.

readBy.name: Shepton Mallet NHS Treatment Centre

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Care is impressive
body: My care has been very impressive in the hospital and I have been very happy with the care I have received. The nurses have been great I am very happy with the care they are given me as it is amazing. They are so kind and have been great at looking after me and I have been privileged to receive the care I have. The nurses are excellent I am very happy with them as rete are great. The doctor have seemed good visits are rare but they do explain everything well. / The foods okay I always get enough and am happy with the quality. I have had no issues and am happy with my care.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Glad we are back to normal
body: It was so good to be able to go into the doctors surgery to see a doctor. My health problems were discussed and help was given in the way of exrays and blood tests to see if there are any major health issues. I felt more assured that if there was anything serious going on, it would be dealt with

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Care is wonderful
body: My care has been absolutely wonderful so far and I am more than happy with the care due to the nature of the staff. They have all been amazing and I am so thankful to have such incredible professionals in charge of my care. They are all so good at what they do and it easy to see they love their job as they work so hard at it and are always smiling. They have been very clear and I have been able to understand them 100 percent. The food has been superb so far I enjoy every meal and love it. The cleaning has been great and I have had no issues with my care

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Improving
body:
Contacted GP by Econsult, a GP rang me within a couple of hours. 
Gp ordered tests, a follow-up appointment and got in the following day to have my bloods done.
Rang again two days later,as l felt so ill. The receptionist was lovely and said a GP would call me back, a GP called me within the hour.
Really good service, prompt and understanding. A vast improvement in my expierence, they seem to be really trying to improve the service. Doing face to face appointments are better to, and makes a big difference. Keep up the good work. Thank you

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Care is good so far
body: My care has been good so far which is due to the staff that have worked so very hard to deliver me such a high level of care and are excellent at everything they do, All the staff on the ward from the domestics top the top have worked so hard and deliver such a professional level of vary. I have had no faults with any of the staff they are all amazing and I thank them. The food has also been wonderful I enjoy every meal and am more hand happy with the food I get. I have had no uses bad an cry thankful for my care

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Amazing birth experience
body: I've had my first baby at Whittington and every doctor and midwife I have met in the 3 days I've been in the hospital, cared so much. I felt very well looked after and safe. You are doing an amazing job ! Thank you for helping me deliver my beautiful daughter !

title: Fantastic service
body: Had appointment come through quickly, very friendly staff, explained everything that was about to happen.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Care is so good so far
body: My care has been very good however it has been a long process and I am ready for my discharge which will hopefully come soon. The nurses have been brilliant and have made the care so much easier due to their absolute brilliance at what they do. They are so kind and have been lovely to me always checking in on me. The doctors are so good and I have seen specialist who have done so much for me and helped me understand everything. The food been really good the portions are small but it tastes great. I Have had no issue with my care and am more than happy with it

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user

body: My care has been amazing so far and I can honestly say that I have experienced no issues since my arrival onto the ward. I have been feeling poorly today however the care has still been incredible and I am more that impressed with tithe nurses have been incredible and have worked so hard to make sure I am happy and don’t need anything. The doctors I couldn’t ask for more. They explain everything well. The food has been decent I enjoy the meals and the portions that I loss. I have had no issues and hope for a discharge soon

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Fond of the nurses

I am particularly thankful for the doctors who have been so kind and considerate. They take so much time to explain everything and make sure I am up date. The nurses have been pretty good I am fond of them as they are always checking in on us patients and making sure we are all okay. The food alright ion have had worse i have had better. I have had no issues with my care and am more than happy

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: First class care
body: My care has been brilliant so far and I am very thankful for it. The nurses have been great so far I honestly think they are brilliant and I am so happy that they look after me. They are first class and have been so considerate. I am privileged to be treated by them and so thankful for them. The doctors have been great so far and their explanations leave me always in the loop and knowing what various testis are for. The food has always been good with the portions being excellent. The care has been excellent and I have had no issues

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Treated very well
body: I have been treated very well in the hospital and I am more than happy with the care I have received as it has been so impressive. The doctors that look after. They have been amazing in helping me understand my care as they are so clear and concise and have worked so hard to deliver me such an impressive level of care. The nurses have been very good they work unreliably hard and have been incredible. I am so impressed by them. The food has been oaky and I am very happy with the portions. I have had no. issues and am grateful for my care

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Amazing receptionists
body: I have consistently received amazing care from the receptionists at posterngate surgery I have found them to be very knowledgeable about my condition, they are always very kind and to be honest if I am unable to get an appointment with the dr I am happy that the receptionists are able to answer any queries which I may have definitely the receptionists at posterngate are as the first point of contact the reason why posterngate has such a good reputation

readBy.name: Healthwatch North Yorkshire

title: Great Experience
body:
I recently underwent surgery at the Medway Maritime hospital and would like to commend the NHS staff for the outstanding care I received.  Thanks to the surgical team who performed the operation to remove my right kidney.  They were very professional and thorough and the operation was a success.
Special thanks to the ICU nurses who looked after me so well during my stay.  They are very caring and dedicated people who are very good at what they do and helped relieve my anxiety during a very stressful time.  Please convey my gratitude to them all and keep up the good work.

readBy.name: Medway NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very good practice I
body: I have been using this surgery for some time, I can honestly say that I’ve never had any issues. I have always been treated with a smile,the staff are very friendly and accommodating,I do feel they always working hard for me, thank you girls, you’re the best , in my eyes.

title: Very Grateful
body: On Thursday the 9th of June I called for assistance as I was having a heart attack. I am truly grateful to the lady who spoke calmly and called me an emergency ambulance, without her swift action and that of the rest of the NHS, it is likely I may not have been here today. Thank you.

title: The best practice I’ve ever been to
body:
I can’t praise this practice enough, they have given me confidence in the NHS again which I had lost at my previous practice, I’m sure every one will know which one it was.
They are kind, helpful and nothing is too much trouble.

title: Spartacular.
body:
I’ve just had my second cataract removal at this spectacular place SpaMedica, I am over the moon with the results, from meeting the doorman on entering the building to the surgeon you are treated with respect, the whole experience is totally painless, I had my first one removed at Team Valley branch and my second at Stockton, both branches were marvellous. I cannot thank them enough. But once again Thank you so much SpaMedica.

Pauline Hurst.

title: Excellent support
body:
Given the low level of public satisfaction nationally, I think it's important to share excellent experience here in the Summertown GP practice. I phoned for an appointment and got a friendly reception response within one minute. An appointment was given to me for a telephone consultation 5 days hence. The doctor phoned me as arranged, listened to my health issue, prescribed a treatment. The prescription reached the chemist that evening.
I really dont think anyone could expect a better level of support. Well done Summertown practice.

title: Blood test
body:
Happy with  booking a appointment,extremely happy with the staff who had taken my blood 

On line ordering for the prescription was very easy to complete

author: taurusjb88
authorRole: a service user
title: Cant get through on phone lines
body:
I keep trying the 0300 number to get through to the Wheelchair service and I have options of pressing numbers, when I press option 2 the line goes dead. Please can this be looked in to?  
Very Frustrating

readBy.name: NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde
St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

title: Great care and consideration
body:
Attended Day Surgery yesterday
My whole experience was wonderful, the care & consideration show to me were exemplary.
From the moment I arrived everyone 
was attentive/ kind & professional.
Would highly recommended on my experience.

author: junexr89
authorRole: a service user
title: Help into employment
body:
I am writing to thank the Individual Placement and Support service in Birmingham for their great support in helping me find a job and gain a sense of self-worth after a long journey in recovery. At this point two years ago I could not envisage being in a position where I had been sober long enough that I could even entertain the idea of getting a job. Even following 18 months of being sober with a volunteer role, I was apprehensive to search for jobs due to previously the disappointment and anxiety being a catalyst for my alcohol use.  
However, through the IPS service and the support of my advisor Shamuil I felt confident enough to start applying for jobs. This was due to him treating me like a human being and being able to speak to me with more compassion rather than treating me just as a target to get into work. Their support was instrumental when facing rejection to see positives and learning opportunities rather than succumbing to feelings of inadequacy. I have now found full-time employment which I don't think would have been possible without having Shamuil to listen to me and pick me back when feeling low.

readBy.name: Change Grow Live
Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

author: Tr5cy
authorRole: a service user
title: Pleasant Medical imaging appointment
body: I attended an appointment today in X-ray Department. Both Lauren & Susan were very welcoming and talked me through whole process & explained each step during appointment. Thanks to both for making the experience a pleasant one.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Scotsman1234
authorRole: a parent/guardian
title: Continence team support for my daughter
body:
This is about my daughter, she has suffered from mental health issues now for a few years, but over the last 3 months things have been really severe with what they bracket FND. Umbrella symptoms, even going into epilepsy centre for 3 weeks to try get diagnosis. She has been taking seizures that affect her body movement, when it happens she sometimes loses the use of her legs, arms speech, for up too a few minutes to hours, including not knowing if she’s needing the toilet.  
This is where a phone call and a visit or two from Gillian & Jennifer, from the Lanarkshire continence team, Hunter health centre East Kilbride. After them seeing my daughter seizure up to 12 times and losing consciousness they decided it’s time for hospital and called an ambulance, even though there shift had finished both of them waited till the ambulance took my daughter to hospital. Follow up visits from them got my daughter the help she required as they contacted everyone that needed to be involved in her care. My daughter is now slowly recovering in ward 20 psychiatric unit in hairmyres.  
Coming home soon to follow up her care with phycologist in the community. My very grateful thanks to both of these health professionals for seeing my daughter as a 21 year old person instead of some seeing her as a problem , with their help now my daughter will get better I’m sure thank you ,💙  
[Very happy with 'Nurses']

readBy.name: NHS Lanarkshire
Scottish Recovery Network
North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Poor telephone information
body: My son needed emergency service today for a very bad cut. The website and answerphone message said they were not accepting walk ins but never the less my husband took him down there.  They were accepting walk-ins.  Surely they have a duty to ensure at least their telephone messages are be up-to-date.

author: equuleusff54
authorRole: a service user
title: Physiotherapy Treatment
body:
Just completed my treatment by physiotherapist Virgina on July 5th. Excellent treatment by a wonderful caring person, I am an OAP and was treated with respect by a friendly, caring and very competent practitioner.  
First class treatment and support in Altnagelvin Area Hospital  
[Unsure about 'Reception']

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Appalling experience
body: My 91 yr old husband who has Parkinson's and is very hard of hearing needed to be seen due to a nasty wound on his shin, received from a fall, a few weeks back. This injury had got infected and was not smelling very good. He was seen by a triage nurse whose only concern was to see if he was still alive and take his temperature! She did not remove the covering to the wound to see what the problem was before sending him back to the waiting room. When asked how they could triage without looking at the problem he was told that was not their job. As it seemed nobody was going to treat this wound he left . I think it is appalling that an elderly person is treated in this casual haphazard way. Hopefully we have now managed to get an appointment at our GP tomorrow with a nurse. The triage nurse should be ashamed of her behaviour to an elderly  patient. All she seemed to be concerned about was telling him about the rules and regulations and no concern for his wound all fall! It's disgusting  behaviour

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Really poor. Barely functional.
body: I find the process of accessing local healthcare at this practice as dismally poor.  On numerous occasions I have tried to book appointments or obtain records only to be confronted by a near impenetrable process. On 13/14 July I tried to get an appointment to see a Doctor without success. Advised to go to A&E instead, and this from being 9th in the phone queue when the practice opened at 08:00hrs. Its just so poor and disheartening to go this every time you need help or advice. If I was being cynical I'd suggest that you don't have enough doctors to be able to function at an acceptable level.

author: LivingNOTSurviving
authorRole: the patient
title: Ealing IAPT - CBT Therapy
body:
I had 11 CBT sessions with Kat for PTSD & Severe Anxiety after sleepless nights and nightmares from being involved in a hit and run. The programme delivered and resources she used helped me to understand how the brain works in regards to trauma. The bit that stood out for me was her ability to make me feel safe, which resulted in me being able to discuss previous traumas I had avoided for years, which I didn'y even realise had a knock on effect to my reactions and my emotions as an adult. The only way to describe our sessions, was like talking to Google - no judgement and an explanation for everything to help me understand me and my trauma better. Best decision I made making the call, sometimes even strong people need help too! Thanks Kat :0)  
[Very happy with 'Seeing the whole me']  
  
[Very happy with 'Treatment']

readBy.name: West London NHS Trust

author: Ellenbrin
authorRole: the patient
title: Implant Removal was a success
body:
I came for an appointment with Julie to have my implant removed as this was due out in 2021.

I’d never had it taken out before and it couldn’t have gone any better thanks to Julie

She made me feel comfortable, relaxed and quite frankly just happy- was a lovely experience and I’d like to think she/ someone in her Team will see this

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

title: 1224 days of waiting
body: I've been waiting 1224 days as urgent case for Eating disorder services under April House. The waiting list seems never ending. I've sadly got to the point of no longer trusting the services and will be no longer willing to work with them even if I do get offered treatment.

readBy.name: Southern Health NHS Foundation Trust
Beat

author: sambahy73
authorRole: the patient
title: Me and making me feel like somebody in the real world.
body:
I caught Covid quite badly a couple of times and diagnosed with long COVID. Also I suffered from Anxiety, stress and worry a lot which caused me to have eventually a nervous breakdown as I just couldn't cope with daily activities. Didn't really know how to relax and take time out for me. Work was a constant battle, no assistance given and or until I returned back. Short of staff.  
Made feel that I was a failure and worry, stress about everything. Anxiety levels high and I lost my sense of purpose for a period of time.  
My GP recommended that I go on a course that was managed by the Inclusion Thurrock Team. It was the best thing I did. The team went through various weekly on-line scenarios which for me helped and I would recommend. Maybe not everything is relevant, but you can take something from the sessions.  
Not sure that I can state the names of the Team, however I will as they fully deserve credit.  
Ellie, Keeley, Tracy and Amaani and Esme.  
Regards and many thanks in getting me back on track.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

title: Usually happy with them but not this time
body:
I’ve been using this practice for years and they’re usually great but since covid it’s not been so great. The doctors never want to see you. 
I thought I may have a uti but explained I didn’t want to just be given antibiotics without a urine test first but the dr said no one can do it for you so you’ll have to go to your gp?!!
I don’t understand why none of the drs/healthcare workers could have done it? 
But she was happy to prescribe me antibiotics without checking first?. 
The reception staff are lovely though.

author: MatthewB
authorRole: a service user
title: Positive Experience - Initial Assessment
body:
I had an initial assessment today with Samantha at Rushcliffe Community Mental Health Team and I have to share the positive experience because it’s beyond anything I’ve ever experienced in years of being a service user of mental health support across multiple areas of the country.  
Samantha was firstly on time and greeted me with such a friendly and relaxed attitude which sets an amazing tone for someone who is nervous and desperate for help. I know we can all run late but there is nothing worse than having an appointment with someone who is late and turns up flustered because I mirror that feeling.  
During the assessment Sam clearly shown her understanding of mental health as a whole, the services offered within the whole of mental health services not just the community team and most importantly was able to not only understand how I felt but also explain the minds way of working in such a simple but informative way that I felt a relief I’ve never felt before. It felt like she was able to climb into my head see what was going on for me, break it down and explain why all of that was happening and making me feel how I do.  
I’m honestly lost for words with how amazing that assessment was. I got in my car, had a cry and then sat there for 15 minutes just smiling because I felt like for once one person understood how I felt and knew what I needed to help me get to a better place.  
Not one mental health practitioner has ever made me feel so understood, not alone and comforted in 15 years of accessing mental health services, until today.  
I just want to thank Sam for being so amazing and making me feel how I do now. I feel safe and that is such a huge feeling for someone who hasn’t their whole life.

readBy.name: Nottinghamshire Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body: I know people are quick to complain, however I have always found the bookings quite quick given the circumstances. pre call with the doctor and appointment the next day

title: If you don’t want to see a GP it’s good.
body:
Trying to get appointments is not easy unless you want a telephone one. 

Asked for a face to face as prefer that but told I had to have a telephone appointment and it would be sometime that day. 

Just missed the call and called straight back to be told they will let the gp know and he will decide if to call you back or have to try and book another appointment. 

Really got impression that they don’t want to see anyone face to face. Been on medication for over a year and never been checked. 

Gave up in end and went to another healthcare provider.

author: EleanoeM
authorRole: the patient
title: The Birth of daughter.
body: This time last year I was just out of the Ulster Maternity unit. I was elated with my New born and the excellent care that was much better than I expected. What should have been a long winded birth turned into an amazing experience due to the care  and positivity of the midwives. I am forever grateful to them for bringing my daughter into the world and for the amazing aftercare provided by the Midwives and Nursing assistants. Thanks you Ulster Maternity. Sorry I toke so long to write this comment.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Very poor. Unable to book appointments
body:
This surgery is incredibly difficult to get an appointment with any sort of doctor. You only be able to get an appointment if you enter some sort of phone lottery at 8am. There are a couple of points this surgery could learn from the world of commerce and customer service 
1/ it really can be so prescriptive to require appointments only to be made at one specific time of day.  People have jobs / other commitments.  This approach means there is a bottle neck of people causing very long wait times. This in turn dissuades people from making appointments. I know from personal experience such this can have significant downstream health impacts 
2/ if the surgery won’t take appointments at other times it would be useful for this to be stated on the phone message rather than me having to wait in a queue for 30mins before the receptionist delivers this news

I know you shouldn’t criticise the NHS but this ain’t to do with under funding or overworked doctors. This is simple poor customer service management at the practise

title: 10/10 Recommend
body: Recently had an operation on my Achilles and calf - very happy with Bath BMI all staff were friendly and knowledgable. Couldn’t fault anything. Food was very nice and large variety. Exceeded my expectations. 10/10 recommend.

title: 111 option 2 (again)
body: This service really needs overhauling: I called earlier today while going through hell- I have mixed anxiety-depressive disorder. The person on the other end of the call exasperated me beyond belief by repeating that she couldn't understand what I was saying. I hung up. Where do they get some of these people from? They are actually worse than useless.

readBy.name: Cambridgeshire And Peterborough NHS Foundation Trust

author: Fioew57
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Everyone is lovely
body:
I was brought into the emergency department by my daughter, I had been on the phone to her, when I mentioned that I wasn’t feeling well. She insisted that she take me up and into the hospital. When I got to the emergency department, I was shocked at how busy the department was. I was very worried that I would be waiting for hours, but I was seen rather quickly. I really appreciated how kind the doctors and nurses were to me. They were very nice and they were very good at answering the questions I had. The doctors and nurses up on the medical ward were just as good. They are so busy on the ward and they do all that they can for me. Everything has been dead on – everyone I have interacted with has been lovely and I cannot complain about my treatment nor my time in the hospital.  
The food has been lovely too – I am so thankful that I am able to eat and not on liquid foods, as the food is amazing, and I have been thoroughly enjoying it. Overall I am very happy with my time in the hospital.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: thubanwc99
authorRole: the patient
title: Unpleasant procedure made better by staff
body:
I had to have a Colonoscopy done at the New Victoria this afternoon and I would just like to say thanks to everyone involved my care.  
Dawn - the receptionist  
Gayle - who saw me into the ward and Jean who took all my details she had just started in the ward the day before and was so good that I would never have known.  
Katie who put my cannula in with no discomfort and took my blood pressure.  
Laura and Lorraine who took me through to theatre and set me up.  
Val who performed my colonoscopy.  
The nurse who make me the best toast and tea.  
Sorry can't remember the name of the nurse who walked me out the ward  
Each and every one of you were very kind and compassionate and put me completely at my ease.  
Val explained everything in detail to me at the end of it and during it made me feel so comfortable  
All in all what could have been an awful experience was really wasn't  
[Unhappy with 'Staff attitude']  
  
[Unsure about 'Staff skills']  
  
[Unsure about 'Team work']  
  
[Unsure about 'Treatment']

readBy.name: NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde

author: Missblondeylocks
authorRole: the patient
title: Implant removal
body: So comfortable and an easy going procedure, freindly staff and good advice!

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

author: Fioew57
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I am quite happy
body:
I have been coming to Daisy Hill for years, for a number of different issues. More recently, I have been coming up to the hospital weekly for blood transfusions. It has become part of my weekly routine, and honestly every time I come to the hospital, everything has been perfect. I am quite happy coming up to the hospital weekly and the nurses are so kind at all times. They are so attentive and caring and they make me feel very much at ease. Honestly I cannot say a bad thing about the nurses here. It feels like I am the centre of their attention, which is also very nice.  
My only issues are with the Car parking. There aren’t enough spaces around the hospital and I wouldn’t mind paying for the parking if the hospital received the money, but from what I know it goes to some third party company – which I find quite annoying.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Absolutely appalling
body: I bought my 4 month old baby here tonyt as she had a heavy chest infection and my gp said if it was to get worse take her to the hospital. I live in Bradford and our Bradford hospital was absolutely full so I decided to bring her here at Halifax the receptionist was so rude to us and the nurse. the doctor was very sweet to us made us feel welcome and checked our baby and said we should get her urine checked and that a nurse would come to us so we waited half hour and so I went to ask the nurse how more long and she gave me a packet and told me what to do so I did as she said and I went to tell her and she told me to go sit back down and that she would come back to me so at this point my baby is screaming now and another half hour gone past and I’ve gone to ask her again and they said to me you should of gone to your nearest hospital instead of coming here? They were just all sat there chatting and they said to me were busy? So I walked out and whilst I was walking out they were carrying on being rude.

author: Fioew57
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: A few issues, but overall very good
body:
I came to Daisy Hill in an ambulance. The ambulance staff were lovely and very kind to me. I really appreciated this in my time of need. I wasn’t waiting too long in the emergency department after I arrived. As a retired nurse, I am probably a nightmare as a patient, but I must say I am very impressed by the care I received in the department and the staff are all fabulous.  
Since being moved up to the ward I have found that the nurses and doctors have been fantastic, they have been very good and professional. The ward is also very clean and tidy, which makes it hard to lose things, thankfully.  
I haven’t been enjoying the food in the slightest. It is desperate – the menu is very repetitive and tasteless. I know that the ward washrooms are kept separate for infection control reasons but it is quite stupid to think that you can have patients on diuretics and need to go to the bathroom but can’t because the bathroom allocated to that ward is in use – at times like this I have been able to use other bathrooms but I think it would be better if the bathrooms weren’t designated to any one ward. I also think there should be a room for the televisions, so patients who want to watch the tv can and those who don’t can be left in peace to do whatever they please, as the tv can be awfully noisy – especially on Sundays with the football now on. It can also be quite noisy but I know it’s not easy for the nurses to do this.  
Overall my time in Daisy Hill has been very positive, and I’m probably just being very picky due to my nursing background. But the staff are a credit to the hospital and they are all lovely.

readBy.name: Northern Ireland ambulance service
Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Fioew57
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Not too bad
body: The staff in Daisy Hill are simply brilliant. The nurses and doctors are very attentive and kind. I was brought into the emergency department and I was concerned about the waiting times, but I honestly wasn’t waiting that long at all. I was seen very quickly and I was very impressed by this. Overall everything was really good. The food has also been quite good and being on the ward is quite enjoyable. You get to meet many different people and learn so much about other people’s lives. There is never a dull moment here.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Blood Test: 10/10
body:
I went to have some blood work done. 

I was blown away at how professional, quick, helpful, kind and skilled my phlebotomist was. I wish I could name them. 

I walked in terrified, stressed and ready to pass out - and walked out feeling that maybe I would be okay after all. 

True hero. 

Thank you. So much.

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a service user
title: I have no concerns the staff are providing great care
body: I have been in hospital for one week, I came in through the emergency department, I got some x-rays carried out and was provided with lots of information from the doctor. They then sent me over to the ward, this ward is very big therefore it has lots of room, it can also get a bit noisy due to the number of patients. The staff have been providing great care to me, and I have no concerns about them.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I couldn’t do it without them, the help they have given me is great
body: I recently received some surgery and am currently recovering. The surgery went very well I am a bit sore now but I have just been resting. The nurses and care assistants are taking great care of me, and I couldn’t do it without them, the help they have given me is great. I haven’t really got an appetite at the moment so I have been struggling to eat the food, although if I could eat it I would. I have tried to soup and some of the jelly deserts they are a bit easier to eat as there lighter, so I’m glad there on the menu.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a service user
title: the cleaners have the ward cleaned very well
body: I have been on the trauma ward for over 10 days now the staff have all been a great help and I really want to thank them for their hard work, they are just brilliant. The cleaners have the ward cleaned very well and I haven’t came across any issues where the ward has been dirty. The food has been okay, the menu is a bit repetitive as it doesn’t change very often, maybe a few small changes are made that’s about it. Especially the lunch and dinner menu they are very similar.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: amazing staff
body: Everything on this ward has been really good so far, the treatment from the staff is amazing I have no complaints. I have seen the cleaners help keep the ward in good condition throughout the days. The facilities all work very well and are very clean also. The food has been lovely, the menu has some of my favourite meals from home on it, which is nice.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Amazing staff
body: Went in with an personal issue that I was really embarrassed about but the staff immediately put me at ease with their kindness & professionalism. The waiting time was next to nothing which is always a bonus in situations where you're already panicking

title: Unacceptable Service
body: I was left a message that there was an issue with my blood test and then when I called the surgery I was told that I would have to wait over two weeks to be told what the problem was, as the doctor only works part time. I asked for a different doctor to call me sooner and I was told this was not possible. So I am expected to wait over 2 weeks to be told what’s going on and any treatment or further tests that are required is also being delayed. Completely unacceptable service!

title: Good Clinical Care but Very Poor Admin
body:
Attended to take an elderly relative for biopsy and the care by both Health Care Assistant and Specialist Nurse was exemplary.
Biopsy follow-up letter confirmed Basal Cell Carcinoma which needed removal. 
Appt letter for removal of skin cancer came (twice) early July but was for 8 June (no date on letter of date it was raised and sent).
Only the Centralised Admin Hub telephone number was on these letters - when I rang them to rebook for my relative I was told I should ring the Primary Care Centre where she was to be seen - this number wasn’t on the appt letters!
A wasted appointment as a time when National Health Service services are under great strain, my elderly relative very distressed at having ‘missed’ an appt and my having to spend over an hour on telephone calls to rebook this appt.

title: Poor service.
body: The practice seems to have barricaded itself in against those they are meant to serve. Really difficult to actually contact the surgery despite the notices it can be contacted by phone, email or visit.  The surgery appears to be doing everything it can to avoid patients. A very unhappy patient!!

title: Not very helpful
body:
Waited many times up to 2 hours on the phone in ques.
Now been in no appointments for month told ring on mornings see if any apps have come up as was told to go back see doctor after 8 weeks and told each week to soon yet till comes to 8 weeks oh nothing this month with any doctor.  
My son had mrsa too few month ago and doctor made appointments while I was in room as told of the struggle. Hopefully moving soon so be leaving. Also reception not very friendly or helpful apart from couple of them

author: atlasrc64
authorRole: a service user
title: Knee replacement
body: Admission to Day Surgery unit was stressful. Not knowing what the process was. A nurse came for me, I picked up my overnight bag and followed them. I found them difficult to understand, asking a serious of questions. They took me back to Waiting area, told me to change. Fortunately I didn't as it was another 3 hrs before operation. Anesthetist came, picked up bag moved to another room. Good explanation of process, explained 3 hr dealy. Back to Waiting room. Theatre nurse came for me. Got changed, picked up bag and lengthy walk. After about 10 minutes the Anesthetist came, more questions, marked knee. Then surgeon came, more questions. They suddenly realised I hadn't signed consent papers. Got that sorted, lifted bag and walked to prep room. Chaos. Calm Anesthetist, slightly overwrought nurse and I found the other nurse to be inadequate. This was stressful for me as patient, whilst staff have to learn, they were making a dreadful job of asking me questions from the form. They also frequently interrupted the other nurse. Anesthetist did their job. Another theatre nurse appeared - they seemed to be on a mission. Tourniquet on thigh, then started telling me I was resisting them - I couldn't feel my legs so there was no way this was the case. Really stressful. After op, recovery ward was relatively good. Moved to Day Care Ward. Staff efficient at all levels. Food dreadful. A Physio had me out of bed to walk. Didn't have any feeling in my foot so it was exceptionally difficult to put foot down on floor. They were impatient with me. I was sick and they huffed about that. A combination of anesthetic, medication and low blood pressure. They arranged for 2 of their colleagues to see me the following day. In the meantime I continued to be sick and still had very little feeling in my foot. Nurses and other ward staff provided a good level of support. Pain relief changed to try and reduce sickness. Consultant came and provided reassurance about my foot. The next day, 2 physio assistants came. Exercises, quickly done, felt dreadful. Stand up, use frame walk over to door, lightheaded and sweating, needing to stop. They were reluctant to let me sit, however my blood pressure had dropped considerably. They said they would be back. A staff nurse came into see me. Provided much needed support and re-assurance, taking time to talk to me. Pain relief, Coffee and toast courtesy of this person, wonderful. They felt it was unlikely I would be discharged that day. The 2 physios came back in the afternoon. On a mission, walk using sticks to door, into corridor, few yards. Step on and off board step. Back in to room. Sit down. I was then told to get my clothes on and I could go home. Even the staff nurse seemed surprised. It's always great to get home, but I honestly don't think I was ready. The discharge process is long- 3 hours plus, and this was frustrating. The staff nurse was excellent, provided support, ran through discharge process thoroughly even although they were busy with other patients and staff. My biggest concerns were lack of structure and calmness prior to op, and the physios lack of compassion. I found the quality of food to be poor, which must be resulting in waste and lack of nutrition for patient recovery.

readBy.name: NHS Forth Valley

title: Can’t fault you
body:
Was referred under a two week rule. Saw consultant in general surgery in June and then had appointment at The Endoscopy Clinic in July.  I was obviously concerned but found all staff approachable and helpful.  Luckily for me nothing untoward was found and the problem I did have was dealt with at the appointment with the clinic.
Please thank all staff in these departments who have been working tirelessly and still treat patients as though every one of us does matter and you are not just a number

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body: Have only recently registered at this practice and have been very impressed. Minimal wait at 8 am  and have got timely appts - telephone and face to face. Clinical and admin staff are helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. Having been at 2 other practices over the past few years, this is like a breath of fresh air. Well done and thank you to all concerned.

author: Jono1
authorRole: the patient
title: Made so welcome
body:
My visit to Grantham hospital. When I arrived and saw the outside of the building I thought what a state it was until I got inside then found it amazing inside so spotless a bit tired but in excellent condition. At reception was greeted with very polite and helpful staff, then I was taken through the paperwork and process of what was going to happen got changed and all through the whole procedure I was treated with care and they couldn’t of done anymore to make me comfortable and at ease. It made my day so much Easier to cope with.  
I would just like to thank all those involved with my treatment on the colonoscopy department, sorry can’t remember names.

readBy.name: United Lincolnshire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Amazing!
body: The GP who delt with me has always been amazing and understood and did everything they possibly could for me! Couldn’t fault him!

title: Fantastic staff
body: Great staff who looked after the patients during very tough times and still do so today thank you for everything

author: Devoted husband
authorRole: a service user
title: Care provided for my wife at home
body:
My wife who is 91 and has both vascular dementia and Alzheimer’s syndrome was referred to the team after contracting a bout of pneumonia and opting to be treated with antibiotics at home rather than being transferred to hospital. Members of the team were on standby in case her situation worsened and injections may have been necessary but this did not prove to be the case. Nurses visited the house and conducted a most professional and empathetic assessment of my wife’s needs regarding equipment like an over-the-bath swivel chair to assist with showering, and frames to assist with using the toilet, and even asked to watch how she coped with getting in and out of bed, and in and out of the car. They were very thorough in their assessment, and kept in telephone contact until they felt she was on an even keel. One unexpected but welcome act was the provision of 10 sets of contact details for other carers and centres where details of experience could be exchanged. We are expecting to be signed off shortly, but have been assured that we need only pick up the phone should anything arise.  
We could not have asked nor received better support from the team, for which we are both very grateful.

readBy.name: Nottinghamshire Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Smokers
body: Why do we continually have to walk through smokers to get and out of the building? Not healthy. They are underneath the signs which say no smoking. Where are the security team. This has been going on now for a number of years.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Email
body:
Hi 
I received a email from you but I cannot open the link to print it as I needed a password I’ve tried the email from long Hanborough but I still cannot print the fit not

title: Great staff. Stress free procedure.
body: Everything was sorted so easily with great staff. It was a stress free experience with instant service.

title: Very good practice with kind, helpful and…
body: joined a few months ago and have been several times for myself and my baby. Very kind, helpful and friendly staff. Easy to get an appointment. Great GPs, nurses and advanced nurse practitioner. Thank you.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Happy enough in the hospital
body: My care has been absolutely great so far and I am more than happy with the care that I have been receiving in the hospital. I can honestly say that I have had no complaints about the care that I have received as it has been exceptional and it means the world to know I have such decimated staff looking after me. The nurses are all first class and I honestly don’t think you could beat them. Doctors are very good and it easy to understand them all as there explanations are brilliant. The foods not bad and I always get enough. I have had no issues and am happy enough to be here as I have recovered very well

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Amazing practice
body:
Having transferred to the practice in December with an underlying condition the doctors were extremely understanding and helpful, time was not an issue. I never failed to get an appointment the same day and was given professional and caring advice. Additionally I also required treatment from the nursing and HCA team. They are a credit to the practice, approachable, efficient and caring.
All the staff on reception reflect extremely well as a first point of contact, coping admirably under pressure especially with the high call volume. 
To conclude, an amazing practice that I can’t praise high enough. Thank you for the incredible amount of time and treatment I have been lucky enough to receive.
Praise indeed, an example for the NHS.

title: Gastroscopy and colonoscopy
body: Had the scope in at top and bottom. A procedure I was not looking forward to. I have to state that every staff member I met was extremely kind and professional, which allowed me to not become stressed. Thanks to all. You do an amazing job!

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Nurses are so fun to talk to
body: My care in the hospital has been good and I am very happy with tithe nurses are very talkative and have been very nice to me. They are brilliant at what they do and work so hard to deliver cracking care. / The doctors I do not know their names however I known they are part of cardiology. They are very nice and despite he language barrier they are brilliant in helping me understand everything. The foods okay I don’t really like some of it however it is edible. My care has been good in the hospital and I have had no issues

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Fioew57
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Kind Staff
body:
I arrived in the emergency department on Thursday – I was waiting for a long time and I wasn’t really that impressed by the wait. However I did notice that the nurses and doctors are very attentive, but I’ve found that some of the nurses become very busy towards the end of their shifts.  
The ward is fine and quiet during the day, but it can be a little noisy at night especially if people are on drips or monitors. On the whole everything is very good here, the food is lovely too. However there have been occasions where I haven’t got the food that I ordered which is more of an annoyance than anything. But everything else has been fine.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Recovering very well thanks to staff
body: My care in the hospital has been very good so far and I am must say that I am very happy with the care that I have been receiving in the hospital. The care has been so good thanks to the wonderful staff that the hospital have. The nurses are exactly what I need to help me recover. I richly had 7kg of fluid drained which meant ii have been feeling unwell but thanks to the staff the process has been so much easier. They have all been so kind and given me so much attention to try and help me recover... The have been very clear and consider and have took so much time to try and explain everything which has helped me so much. The food has even great and despite my low appetite I still enjoy the food that I get. The care has been excellent an I am more than happy with it.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent department
body:
The experience yesterday was second to none. From start to finish the whole team was so friendly and caring.
So glad I shall be returning soon to have 2nd eye done.
A huge thanknyou to you all.

title: Excellent Service
body: Really put me at ease when having my blood tests taken and booking my blood tests. The staff are all very professional and polite and always there to offer help and advice. Thank you.

author: Cheeky chops
authorRole: a service user
title: Implant removed and replaced
body: I had a lovely lovely nurse called Sarah! She was so kind and made me feel so relaxed. She has made a fab job of the procedure and the booking of the appointment was a breeze! Thank goodness for the NHS!

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust

author: Auds70
authorRole: a relative
title: Post op difficulties
body: I just want to thank Mr Mcmahon, his team and all the nursing staff for looking after our dad. Last week he experienced complications post-op. The staff went above and beyond to stabilise his condition, staying on after their shift to ensure his safety. A special mention to staff nurse Lesley and the Registrar on call who took time to reassure us and explain everything that was happening. We are relieved that the 2nd op has helped and every day he is getting better. A big thank you to nursing and medical staff in both ward 62 and ward 60 HDU for their care and attention. The Family

readBy.name: NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde
